result.execSummary:
The defendant Shana Lee Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Concurrent with: count 3 & concurrent to 15CF1694

Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Concurrent with: count 3 & concurrent to 15CF1694

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim R.W. (person, property, residence or family) unless approved by agent. May not reside with mother and will communication with mother up to the agent. Pay outstanding ZCI fees. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

15CF1694: count 3, count 4 & count 5- GUILTY; DRI the balance.

Ct 5- 4 years WPS, 2 init, 2 es, i/s, 3 years prob concurrent to ct 3 & 4

15CF619
Ct 2- 4 years WPS, 2 yrs init, 2 yrs es, i/s, 3 years probation

Ct 3- 9 months RCJ, to run concurrent with 15CF1409 & 15CF1694 - eligible for expungement in 15CF619

Conditions:

Defendant Shana Lee Smith in court with attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger.  Defendant Shana Lee Smith in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue

ZCI report
CO SIGNED BY MOTHER CHRISTA SMITH

CO-SIGNED BY MOTHER, CHRISTA SMITH WITH PHOTO I.D.
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). C.S. , S.W. & C.W.    It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant must live with mother and grandfather at 4407 Meadow Dr. Defendant must comply with treatment program.
